This is an important communication from your Regional Director of NAEB.
urge you to give it your full and immediate attention.
The Board of Directors of NAEB, at a recent meeting ia New York City*
voted to allow the Executive Director and Director of Region V to pro¬
ceed with plans for a REGIONAL CONFERENCE in Region V. This conference
uoulu be a pilot project0 If Region 7 get»to-gather is a success and
meets the needs of active members* other regional conferences may be
held in the future over the nation*
At the resent National Convention in Biloxi, only four of the eleven
active members of this region wore present. For Some time, I have con¬
tended that the real strength of NAEB is in the regions and that we need
REGIONAL CONFERENCES where we can discuss our mutual and special prob¬
lems and thereby build a stronger national organisation.
At our conference, we would discus3 those things which YOU would want to
bring out into the open; we would attempt to be mutually helpful.
Certainly such a meeting would unite us in a commonness of purpose—a
keen realisation of just what, cur responsibilities are in this thing call¬
ed educational broadcasting. Last but not least, wo would get to know and
respect each other — something which ia sadly lacking in Region V*
Tho national office would be represented at this meeting and possibly a
top ranking consultant in educational broadcast!ng would be availablet.
An opportunity would be afforded all of you to learn more about the
national set-up of NAEB firsthand; ana the consultant would be an inspira¬
tion for all of us. But in the main, the agenda for the two day meeting
would com© from YOU — regional members who actually work in educational
radio. Everything would bo geared to your level of interest and needs.
More detailed information about the proposed REGIONAL CONFERENCE is en¬
closed. We used to know your reaction to the idea ofa REGIONAL CONFERENCE
as well as certain other pertinent information by return mail.
Immediate action is of the utmost importance.
Sincerely yours.
John W. Dunn
